Go Ahead Tours offers industry-leading guided group tours to destinations that span all seven continents. For more information, visit www.goaheadtours.com.

Go Ahead Tours is a division of EF Education First. Founded in 1965 by entrepreneur Bertil Hult, EF is a privately-held company with 15 divisions that offer a range of educational programs from language training, educational travel, and academic degrees to cultural exchanges. With a mission to open the world through education, EF has helped people of all ages and nationalities become citizens of the world. For more information, visit http://www.ef.com/careers

EF is an equal opportunities employer. EF offers competitive salaries and a multicultural working environment. If you are motivated by the prospect of an international career with a dynamic and forward-thinking company, we want to hear from you. For more information, visit www.ef.com/careers.

name: Front End Software Engineer
contents:
Axial (www.axial.net) is building the online capital market for private companies - connecting those companies to the capital they need to succeed. CEOs and transaction professionals join Axial to access advice and capital, build relationships, and exchange opportunities that help them and their organizations grow. Axial is the largest network on the internet for professionals who run, advise, and finance private companies.

As a Front End Engineer at Axial, you will build beautiful, intuitive, and progressive web and mobile products using Angular 2, Redux, the Pyramid web application framework, and Ionic. You will work on the same team as Product Managers, UX Designers, and Reliability Engineers who specify, design, and test the products and business improvement solutions you create.

The Problems You’ll Solve
You’ll solve difficult technical problems so our Members don’t have to. Some of our biggest challenges right now are:

  • Going Reactive. We’re building a reactive system with the tenets that the system should be responsive, resilient, elastic, and message driven. You will be building highly testable services that follow the above requirements.
  • Search. Search connects entrepreneurs and their advisors with capital and services.  By constantly improving search and by innovating on top of the latest techniques including AI and machine learning, we help our Members:
            - secure the capital needed to finance or sell their business
            - connect and build relationships
            - constantly improve relevancy
  • Modernize. Our members expect Axial to work equally well on their desktop, tablet, and mobile devices. We obsess over our members and we’re committed to modernizing our platform to exceed the demands of our members.
  • Go SOA. We believe our data is our business, and we believe that modular interfaces making use of decoupled data services give us the maximum flexibility and utility.

The Axial Corps of Engineers
We’re a team of highly talented, ambitious, and tenacious Engineers dedicated to achieving excellence in every aspect and level of our system.  In pursuit of excellence, we foster a strong community where productive collaboration and an ecosystem built on fundamental values and principles cause us to push each other far beyond what we’d be able to achieve individually or in a different environment.

  • We’re intellectually curious, humble, and discerning
  • We find beauty in and are passionate about well engineered code
  • Simplicity and flexibility are our guide
  • We minimize bureaucracy and are allergic to office politics
  • We keep connected to the NYC Engineering and startup communities to share our passion and to ensure we don’t become insulated in our perspective

You’re an ideal candidate if you ...

  • communicate and collaborate well
  • are a seasoned Software expert
  • have designed and implemented distributed HTTP data services
  • have built beautiful, contemporary web based user interfaces
  • have extensive SQL experience
  • have worked with git and other open source development tools
  • are experienced working with and managing a Unix system

The benefits of being an Axialite ...

  • competitive salary and equity
  • we buy you all the best tools and books you need
  • conveniently located, beautiful Flatiron office (near 4/5/6/N/R/Q/L/F)
  • snacks and weekly catered lunches
  • gym subsidy
  • bike friendly

name: Software Engineer Program
contents:
Imagitas is hiring a Software Engineer Program.

The Red Ventures Software Engineer Program targets high performing individuals who have demonstrated a track record of success through educational and internship performance within Computer Science. As a Software Engineer Associate, you will work on a wide array of projects ranging from customer facing websites and social API integrations to proprietary search marketing tools. This won’t be just an entry-level role. You’ll have the opportunity to own a project from production to deployment working alongside a dedicated team of industry-leading Engineers.

Responsibilities:

  • Architect and develop web-based applications and components for high-traffic consumer-facing websites
  • Work alongside business leaders and analysts to determine business requirements and rapidly translate them into creative and effective solutions
  • Work with automated build and unit testing platforms
  • Maintain your own project timelines in a fast-paced environment

Preferred Background:

  • Preferred major in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, or other related field
  • Recent experience in hands-on software design and backend coding through internships, work experience, or side projects is highly preferred
  • Knowledge of PHP programming language, JavaScript and MySQL database
  • Object Oriented Programming and software design ability preferred; able to develop systems that meet architectural objectives including reusable, scalable code
  • Experience with other awesome web languages (Node.js, React, Angular) is a plus
  • Highly self-motivated, creative problem-solver, and quick learner
  • Detail oriented with the ability to prioritize, execute and deliver projects on time

Red Ventures Associate Program:

The Red Ventures Associate Program targets high performing college seniors who have demonstrated a track record of success through educational and internship performance. The program consists of four specific positions including: Strategic Analyst Associate and Software Engineer Associate. We recruit for each position based on specific skillsets and background. However, all Associates will benefit from group on-boarding, company sponsored events, and on-the-job training. Given our intense focus on talent management, new college graduates starting in one of these positions can experience unparalleled career progression.College graduates have the opportunity to prove themselves and quickly take on new responsibilities and challenges. Even as a new associate, you’ll have daily exposure to our executive team and benefit from their experience, including tier-one MBA programs like Harvard Business School, Stanford Business School, and Wharton Business School coupled with companies such as Capital One, McKinsey & Company, Procter & Gamble, General Electric, and more.

name: Staff Software Engineer, Brand
contents:
Quantcast is a large scale, data driven organization that lives and breathes data, processing well over a million transactions a second. The Brand team builds large scale modeling systems that let us target online users across the web. We leverage our large datasets, computational power and analytic tools to build high quality and diverse targeting products that support Quantcast’s position as a world class leader in online advertising.

We are looking for people with strong engineering and big data experience to expand our Brand Targeting and Inventory Quality capabilities. As a Staff Software Engineer you will design and build systems to identify the right user to target at the right time on the right website. You will collaborate with other engineers and work on a variety of large scale systems including our MapReduce cluster and global realtime bidding system. You will model suspicious online behavior to track down botnets and other fraudsters. You will develop behavioral models to understand and describe the interests and trends of the online community.

Responsibilities

  • Develop software to target users at large scale around the globe
  • Lead software projects through the full technical life cycle, from design and development through deployment and support
  • Work with other engineering teams to coordinate building brand targeting pipelines with other projects
  • Work with product management and internal clients to gather project requirements and communicate project impacts
  • Mentor and provide guidance for senior and junior engineers

Requirements

  • 10+ years experience working with high performance software
  • 5+ years experience with MapReduce or other large scale distributed computing systems
  • 5+ years experience leading all phases of software projects
  • Degree in a topic related to Computer Science (Master’s/PhD prefered)
  • Experience developing an engineering culture of high standards and best practices
  • Experience working with non-engineering teams to define projects and set expectations
  • Experience as the tech lead for cross team projects
  • Nice to have: Experience in the online advertising space

Quantcast helps create a more personalized digital world. We have built one of the world’s most sophisticated data-intelligence platforms, utilizing big data and machine learning to solve the biggest challenges in marketing and create more rewarding experiences across the digital landscape. Publishers use our insights to better understand audiences and how content resonates with consumers they want to attract and retain. Marketers utilize our understanding of online behavior and our predictive advertising capabilities to reach the customers likeliest to engage with their messages. Consumers see the results of our work in relevant stories and advertisements that create a personalized experience across all of their devices.

Quantcast was honored as a Glassdoor Best Place to Work in 2015 & 2016. To learn more, follow Quantcast on Glassdoor.

name: Software Engineer, Experimentation Platform
contents:
Experimentation at Airbnb:

We develop tools that help every employee at Airbnb make data-driven decisions. Every team at Airbnb—product, operations, customer support, and leadership—relies on the data we collect about user behaviors and needs to make impactful decisions. Our toolchain democratizes access to data for everyone and makes it easy and painless to run A/B tests to establish cause and effect.

Our work is high-leverage: it makes the entire company, particularly the product organization, able to iterate faster and make changes that accelerate business growth. You will have visibility into every other team. Great candidates thrive at the intersection of Software Engineering and Data Science and are motivated to help Data Scientists, Product Managers, and Software Engineers make data-driven decisions.

What are some examples of work done at Airbnb?

Experiment Reporting Framework: Our homegrown A/B testing platform, which automates experiment setup, assignment, and analysis, and displays experiment results in a way that makes decision-making easy and fast. A/B testing is the building block of decision-making on Airbnb's product team.

Blog post: http://nerds.airbnb.com/experiment-reporting-framework/ 

The following experience is relevant to us:

  • Building A/B testing tools that allow engineers and product managers to deploy experiments and analyze their results
  • Leveraging data infrastructure and distributed systems to answer questions
  • Identifying internal information needs and addressing them by creating novel tools
  • Working with data at scale, specifically with distributed systems
  • Background in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Math or other quantitative related field is preferred

 Benefits

  • Stock
  • Competitive salaries
  • Quarterly employee travel coupon
  • Paid time off
  • Medical, dental, & vision insurance
  • Life insurance and disability benefits
  • Fitness Discounts
  • 401K
  • Flexible Spending Accounts
  • Apple equipment
  • Commuter Subsidies
  • Community Involvement (4 hours per month to give back to the community)
  • Company sponsored tech talks and happy hours
  • Much more...

name: Engineering Manager, Infrastructure
contents:
Engineering Managers, Infrastructure at Airbnb

Airbnb’s core business, engineering team and number of new products is rapidly growing, all in an effort to create a world where everyone in the world can Belong Anywhere. To keep up with the scale, one of Airbnb’s biggest investments is in infrastructure engineering. Our infrastructure teams are concerned with making our engineers and data scientists productive, our site available to hosts and guests and our company (people and products) informed by data.

Some examples of current infrastructure work:

  • A publish-subscribe message bus to allow for simple, reliable inter-service communication
  • A development environment that enables standardized testing and interaction between services
  • Distributed tracing infrastructure that allows us to find bottlenecks across our entire system and trace errors
  • Projects to drive real-time data adoption across the company
  • Continuous performance profiling to keep our response times down
  • A video service, which will be used by several product teams

We value Engineering Managers who have:

  • Required: 7+ years of relevant engineering work experience and 4+ hands-on technical management experience
  • Exceptional coding abilities and experience with architectural patterns of large, high-scale applications
  • Track record in partnering with recruiting to build incredible engineering teams
  • Actively coached and mentored team members in their careers
  • Been actively involved in setting product strategy
  • Shipped several large scale projects with multiple dependencies across teams

Benefits:

  • Stock
  • Competitive salaries
  • Quarterly employee travel coupon
  • Paid time off
  • Medical, dental, & vision insurance
  • Life insurance and disability benefits
  • Fitness discounts
  • 401K
  • Flexible Spending Accounts
  • Apple equipment
  • Commuter subsidies
  • Community involvement (4 hours per month to give back to the community)
  • Company sponsored tech talks and happy hours
  • Breakfast, lunch, and dinner
  • Much more...

name: Pessoa Consultora Desenvolvedora de Software
contents:
A ThoughtWorks é uma comunidade de pessoas apaixonadas com o propósito de revolucionar o design e a criação de software, enquanto defende uma mudança social positiva.

Nós entendemos que o desenvolvimento de software é uma experiência libertadora, evolutiva e rápida – gerentes de projeto, desenvolvedores, testadores e analistas de negócio trabalhando colaborativamente com os clientes para entregar resultados visíveis e imediatos.

Buscamos tanto conhecimento e curiosidade intelectual para resolver problemas. A ideia de trabalhar lado a lado com pessoas que escreveram livros sobre os assuntos que lhe interessam vai te atrair e você compartilhará nosso interesse por Padrões de Projeto, refatoração, Integração Contínua, TDD (Test Driven Development) e Ágil.

Aqui você terá a oportunidade de:

  • Fazer parte de uma consultoria global de tecnologia que quer mudar o mundo;
  • Apresentar, utilizar e melhorar práticas de desenvolvimento ágil, incluindo Integração Contínua (Go, Jenkins, etc) e Desenvolvimento Orientado a Testes (TDD - Test Driven Development);
  • Trabalhar em aplicações de negócios em multi-camadas e com design personalizado, que utilizam as mais recentes tecnologias para a construção de sistemas críticos e escaláveis;
  • Contribuir e colaborar com a equipe e clientes durante todo o processo de desenvolvimento de software;
  • Atuar como coach e disseminar o conhecimento das melhores práticas no desenvolvimento de software dentro e fora da ThoughtWorks;
  • Ser parte de um ambiente aberto e não hierárquico onde se espera que todos colaborem dentro do projeto e nas direções da organização.

Esperamos que você:

  • Goste de programar.
  • Se diverte programando uma aplicação para web 2.0 ou um framework para facilitar suas atividades diárias;
  • Tenha experiência com desenvolvimento em Java, .NET, Python e/ou Ruby. Você poderá nos mostrar um pouco do seu talento durante nosso processo de seleção;
  • Tenha experiência com análise, design, codificação e implementação de aplicações OO coorporativas personalizadas;
  • Capacidade de trabalhar em equipe, em um ambiente colaborativo;
  • Tenha experiência de trabalho com métodos ágeis - incluindo XP, Scrum e desenvolvimento iterativo - seria fantástico. Se você ainda não teve a oportunidade de trabalhar em um ambiente ágil, você já leu tudo sobre esta metodologia;
  • Capacidade de comunicação, com habilidade de trabalhar e construir um relacionamento com o cliente dentro de um ambiente de consultoria;

Características diferenciais:

  • Bons conhecimentos de padrões de projeto, refatoração e testes unitários;
  • Experiência de trabalho com métodos ágeis, XP, Scrum e / ou Kanban;
  • Experiência na escolha e aplicação de boas práticas de software como Test Driven Development (TDD), integração e entrega contínua;
  • Participação ativa dentro da comunidade de TI como um palestrante, autor ou colaborador.

Acreditamos em conhecer as pessoas sob vários olhares, então além de anexar seu currículos, gostaríamos de te conhecer um pouco mais através de algumas perguntas que você encontrará ao clicar em "Apply for this job".

A ThoughtWorks tem orgulho de ser uma empresa que preza pela igualdade de oportunidades.

Candidatos são considerados para todas as vagas, sem distinção de raça, cor, religião, gênero e identidade de gênero, nacionalidade, deficiência, orientação sexual, ascendência ou idade.

PCD's https://info.thoughtworks.com/pcds

Conheça nosso pilar de Justiça Econômica e Social

name: Software Engineer, DevOps
contents:
Plano 1 (31061), United States of America, Plano, Texas

At Capital One, we’re building a leading information-based technology company. Still founder-led by Chairman and Chief Executive Officer Richard Fairbank, Capital One is on a mission to help our customers succeed by bringing ingenuity, simplicity, and humanity to banking. We measure our efforts by the success our customers enjoy and the advocacy they exhibit. We are succeeding because they are succeeding.

Guided by our shared values, we thrive in an environment where collaboration and openness are valued. We believe that innovation is powered by perspective and that teamwork and respect for each other lead to superior results. We elevate each other and obsess about doing the right thing. Our associates serve with humility and a deep respect for their responsibility in helping our customers achieve their goals and realize their dreams. Together, we are on a quest to change banking for good.

Software Engineer, DevOps

As a Capital One Software Engineer, you'll work on everything from customer-facing web and mobile applications using cutting-edge open source frameworks, to highly-available RESTful services, to back-end Java based systems using the hottest techniques in Big Data. You'll bring solid experience in emerging and traditional technologies such as: node.js, Java, AngularJS, React, Python, REST, JSON, XML, Ruby, HTML / HTML5, CSS, NoSQL databases, relational databases, Hadoop, Chef, Maven, iOS, Android, and AWS/Cloud Infrastructure to name a few.

What you’ll do:

  • Work with product owners to understand desired application capabilities and testing scenarios
  • Continuously improve software engineering practices
  • Work within and across Agile teams to design, develop, test, implement, and support technical solutions across a full-stack of development tools and technologies
  • Lead the craftsmanship, availability, resilience, and scalability of your solutions
  • Bring a passion to stay on top of tech trends, experiment with and learn new technologies, participate in internal & external technology communities, and mentor other members of the engineering community
  • Encourage innovation, implementation of cutting-edge technologies, inclusion, outside-of-the-box thinking, teamwork, self-organization, and diversity

Position Summary

As a DevOps Engineer you will be a forward leaning technical leader among a Team of 5 - 10 engineers. You will drive devops culture throughout the auto lending technology department through creating application and environment automation, creating build pipelines, and creating automation to manage the environments.

Basic Qualifications

  • Work within and across Agile teams to design, develop, test, implement, and support technical solutions across a full-stack of development tools and technologies
  • Lead the craftsmanship, availability, resilience, and scalability of your solutions
  • Bring a passion to stay on top of tech trends, experiment with and learn new technologies, participate in internal & external technology communities, and mentor other members of the engineering community
  • Encourage innovation, implementation of cutting-edge technologies, inclusion, outside-of-the-box thinking, teamwork, self-organization, and diversity

Position Summary

As a DevOps Engineer you will be a forward leaning technical leader among a Team of 5 - 10 engineers. You will drive devops culture throughout the auto lending technology department through creating application and environment automation, creating build pipelines, and creating automation to manage the environments.

Basic Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree or military experience.
  • At least 1 year of experience in technology delivery in a DevOps / Cloud Engineering environment.
  • At least 2 years of engineering experience in Unix or Windows environments.
  • At least 1+ year of experience with AWS core technologies (EC2, EBS, S3, VPC, etc.)
  • At least 1 year of experience implementing automated environment delivery using Open Source tools such as Chef or Ansible
  • At least 1 year of experience implementing automated environment delivery using Cloud Formation Templates
  • At least 1 year of developing automation workflows and continuous delivery pipelines using Open Source Tools such as Jenkins or equivalent.
  • At least 1 year of experience with Python or similar scripting / automation language
  • At least 1 year of experience with networking concepts and networking troubleshooting in the cloud.
  • At least 1 year of experience in a large-scale, high volume and high availability critical system implementation.
  • At least 1 year of experience in infrastructure design, implementation and delivery.
  • At least 1 year of experience working with Agile Development Practices.
  • At least 1 year of experience with web services architecture.
  • At least one year experience using the AWS API / CLI for automation

Preferred Qualifications

  • Certified AWS Architect.
  • 2+ years of experience with Linux, server automation and scripting.
  • 1+ years with Terraform
  • 1+ year of experience with Container technology using Docker.
  • 1+ year of experience with an infrastructure test automation tool like ServerSpec or equivalent
  • 3+ years of experience with OOP concepts and 3+ years of experience with modern scripting languages and frameworks.
  • 2+ years of database experience with a relational or NoSQL database (Cassandra).
  • 1+ years of experience with monitoring tools such as Splunk, Zabbix, AppDynamics.
  • 1+ years of experience with tomcat
  • 1+ years of experience with apache

name: QA Product Engineer - CAD Integration
contents:
Overview

Are you passionate about integrating CAD data with GIS? Are you eager to apply your passion for software quality and your knowledge of testing to help release robust, high-quality functionality and tools? Apply your creativity and analytical skills to help our CAD team test and deploy CAD integration tools and applications.

 

We’re responsible for designing, implementing, documenting, and testing all the great new features we add into CAD integration and interoperability tools. You will be working in a fast-paced environment where product delivery cycles are frequent.

 

Responsibilities:

  • Test, release, and support ArcGIS CAD integration software to enhance overall product quality
  • Define user requirements and apply best practices for using GIS software in various real-world scenarios
  • Create and execute high-quality test plans
  • Manage and maintain the automation of new and current tests through various test harnesses
  • Drive and promote quality assurance within the team
  • Perform troubleshooting to resolve software defects

Requirements

  • C# developer or QA engineer with 2+ years of experience using ArcObjects or the ArcGIS Runtime SDK for .NET
  • 1+ years of experience working with WPF
  • Understanding of the ArcGIS platform (Desktop, Server, Online, Apps)
  • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including presentation skills
  • Proven ability to deliver work, in teams or individually
  • Effective time management and organizational skills
  • Passion and ability to make a difference
  • Bachelor’s or master’s in computer science, mathematics, GIS, or a related field, depending on position level

Recommended Qualifications

  • Industry experience in software development or software testing
  • 2+ years of experience working with CAD software (e.g., AutoCAD, MicroStation)
  • 1+ years of Python programming experience
  • Experience with AutoLISP programming

 

The Company

Our passion for improving quality of life through geography is at the heart of everything we do. Esri’s geographic information system (GIS) technology inspires and enables governments, universities, and businesses worldwide to save money, lives, and our environment through a deeper understanding of the changing world around them.

 

Carefully managed growth and zero debt give Esri stability that is uncommon in today's volatile business world. Privately held, we offer exceptional benefits, competitive salaries, 401(k) and profit-sharing programs, opportunities for personal and professional growth, and much more.

 

Esri is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

name: iOS Senior Engineer : Chicago
contents:
The Nerdery is seeking a Mobile Senior Software Engineer to work on a wide variety of projects as part of our team.

 

About the Software Engineering Team

At the Nerdery, our Software Engineering team believes strongly in quality workmanship, meaningful collaboration, and outstanding customer service. We pride ourselves on being able to partner with our clients to develop custom software to solve their business problems.

From startups to corporations, our team makes an impact on millions of users every day.

About the Position

As a Mobile Senior Software Engineer at The Nerdery, you'll have the opportunity to work on projects for a wide range of clients. You'll be using the latest releases from Apple and also have the opportunity to take on stretch assignments to help you reach your personal development goals.

Most of our engineers contribute to a multitude of projects each year. You’ll never feel like you’re stuck working on a single project for the rest of your career.

About You

You are passionate, flexible, and ready to collaborate with talented engineers to craft brilliant applications from even bigger ideas. You’re a strong developer who pays attention to the details of a design, chooses the right tool for the job, and values including all users.

Job Responsibilities

  • Work with clients to understand business needs and create technical solutions

  • Provide technical feedback and leadership to other team members

  • Review and intake design assets from our partners and provide feedback on the technical implications

  • Architect and implement maintainable, scalable, and modular applications and integrate them with a diverse set of back-end platforms

  • Document key aspects of a project for the client, and other team members

  • Contribute to our collective brain power through innovation and peer review

What’s Next

After you submit your application, you’ll talk with a Nerdery Talent Advocate. The Talent Advocate will answer any questions you have about the job and validate that you’re the person we’re looking for. Next, you’ll receive the Nerdery Assessment Test (NAT). The NAT is a quick exercise that will provide you with an opportunity to showcase your technical skills. Once complete, an engineer from our team will review your NAT and either provide you with in-depth feedback on the submissions or invite you to a second interview to discuss the opportunity to join our team.

 

We hope to hear from you soon!

name: Mobile QA Engineer
contents:
Omnigon builds sites, apps, and systems for some of the biggest teams and brands in the world.  We are looking for a QA Mobile Engineers to join our office.  We seek accomplished, detail-oriented, web-savvy software testing professional(s) with expertise in software development for testing. 

The ideal candidate will have experience delivering quality software products and apps.  Experience in Sports, Media, and Entertainment preferred. 

Skills required:

  • Experience of mobile apps testing  
  • Experience of requirements testing
  • Experience with requirements management software
  • Automation experience will be advantage
  • Good written and basic spoken English

Benefits:

  • Competitive salary with regular pay and yearly bonus
  • Good working environment, office conveniently located in the center of St Petersburg
  • Medical Insurance
  • English courses
  • Opportunity to improve English skills by regular communication with native speakers
  • Flexible work schedule
  • Book club, events and democratic atmosphere in the team
  • We will help in relocating from another city

About Omnigon:

Omnigon is a team of digital strategists, artists and technologists working exclusively in digital content delivery in the sports, media and entertainment industries. Since its founding in 2008, Omnigon has established itself as a market leader, focused on helping clients achieve returns on the strategic, creative and technical investments they’ve made. Omnigon, headquartered in New York and with offices in Los Angeles, London, Toronto, Kiev and St. Petersburg, works with celebrated, global brands including PGA TOUR, AS Roma, NASCAR, World Rugby, Arsenal FC, Little League International, the United States Golf Association (USGA), FOX Sports, Miami Heat and countless others.

name: Senior iOS Engineer
contents:
Would you like the opportunity to work on mobile app projects seen by millions of people daily? Are you interested in developing products for the Sports and Entertainment world? Join us!  We are an independent software development shop that creates custom apps and sites for sports, media and entertainment companies. 

We are looking for highly talented iOS Engineers to join our office.  All engineers write code about 80% of the time and attend meetings and review requirements the other 20%. 

Skills required:

  • 4+ years iOS development experience
  • Projects on the App Store
  • Strong knowledge of Objective C
  • Understanding the patterns
  • Ability to effectively use CocoaPods
  • Understanding the basics of multithreaded programming
  • English (good written and basic spoken)

  • Good working environment, office conveniently located in the center of St Petersburg
  • Medical Insurance

name: iOS Development Mentor - Part-Time
contents:
Positions open in Vancouver, Toronto & more.

You are a rare breed: a strong programmer who is passionate about mentorship & education. You believe in learning by doing (even if you’re traditionally trained), and you love people almost as much as you love code.

Our curriculum is built to accommodate different levels at once, using a hands on method, tons of 1-on-1 mentorship through amazing teacher/developers who want nothing more than to get the best out of ambitious, passionate & driven people.

Mentors are responsible for handling any and all questions that come up. This includes pair programming and debugging issues with them, which in most cases is more valuable for the students than giving them an answer. Code reviewing and helping students refactor their code is also a big part of being a mentor.

Teaching at Lighthouse Labs is secondary to most developers’ primary responsibility, and can be for 6-20 hours a week.

Technical Qualifications:

  • At least 2 years of professional experience in iOS development
  • Passion for teaching and helping others
  • Strong communication skills, articulating and explaining concepts
  • Have mentored junior developers in a professional or personal capacity
  • Previous teaching experience is not required. (We've been doing this for a while, have 50+ p/t teachers and know exactly how to bring new teachers up to speed)

Work with students like Navaneethan, a Lighthouse Labs iOS Development Alumnus:

To apply, visit www.lighthouselabs.ca/careers-at-lhl or submit a resume & cover letter to Kate Ciborowski below.

name: Software Engineer, Booking Experience
contents:
What is the Booking team at Airbnb?

The Booking team is responsible for the core host and guest booking experience. Our goal is to simplify the booking flow to make it easier to book an incredible trip on Airbnb. We're solving multi-faceted problems at the heart of our business, such as accurate availability, matching, and host preferences.

The Booking team has a broad scope, which means you’ll have ownership and impact on large chunks of our core product. We’ve worked on the messaging system, checkout page and listing management tools. As a team member, you’ll help grow the team and have lots of responsibility.

Our work spans from backend services all the way to beautiful UI’s, and we’re looking for full-stack engineers who want to design and implement new features for Airbnb. Engineers play a key role in product development from concept to launch. As part of the team, you’ll have a huge impact on the future of Airbnb.

 

The following experience is relevant to us:

  • Ability to work anywhere in the technical stack, delivering quality code both on the frontend and backend.
  • Familiarity with React/Javascript/Java/Ruby-on-Rails is a plus.
  • Experience building and passionate about creating great products
  • Analytical thinking and experience with data and A/B testing to make product decisions

Benefits

  • Stock
  • Competitive salaries
  • Quarterly employee travel coupon
  • Paid time off
  • Medical, dental, & vision insurance
  • Life insurance and disability benefits
  • Fitness Discounts
  • 401K
  • Flexible Spending Accounts
  • Apple equipment
  • Commuter Subsidies
  • Community Involvement (4 hours per month to give back to the community)
  • Company sponsored tech talks and happy hours
  • Much more...

name: Customer Success Architect
contents:
About the Team:

Customers are the lifeblood of our company, and MuleSoft is looking for a unique combination of technical vision and leadership to grow our customer relationships. The Customer Success Architect (CSA) at MuleSoft will guide our customers to thrive and grow on MuleSoft’s Anypoint Platform. CSA’s will work closely with MuleSoft’s most strategic customers throughout the customer lifecycle from pre-implementation through go-live.

About the Position:

In this truly entrepreneurial role, you will immerse yourself in the projects and goals for a handful of key accounts. You will directly contribute to a customer’s success with MuleSoft products by providing the customer with architectural guidance, technical leadership, advice and both MuleSoft and complementary product recommendations.

As part of the role, you will help to advance the customer's integration maturity and cost-effectiveness by providing guidance around architectural strategy, common patterns, centralized management, shared infrastructure and other best practices. You will also help the customer to define and set up their operating model (MuleSoft’s Center for Enablement), including the identification of MuleSoft experts, knowledge and code repositories and reusable components.

You will have the opportunity to further demonstrate industry thought leadership through public speaking events, MuleSoft Summits, published papers and customer case studies.

This position may require some travel throughout EMEA as per business need. The ideal candidate will be as passionate about MuleSoft solutions, APIs and leading edge integration best practice as they are about providing an exceptional experience for every customer.

Position Deliverables:

  • 30 days:
    • You will be able to hit the ground running, master the Anypoint products and quickly establish your credibility across the organization
    • You will review our existing industry go-to-market strategy and product roadmap, as well as identify patterns that have promoted a successful enterprise connectivity model in existing customers
    • You will begin to learn the business challenges and opportunities for your future accounts
  • 60 days:
    • You will have developed a point of view on MuleSoft’s Centre for Enablement, API led integration architectures and strategies for change
    • You will get engaged with your book of customers, to understand their current and future projects, and begin to add value
  • 90 days:
    • You will be ingrained across the company as the go-to subject matter expert when it comes to your specific industry or area of expertise, particularly with regards to technical matters
    • You will also have sufficient understanding of our strategic objectives, and what is needed for us to be successful, so that you proactively drive your own work agenda from here on out

About You:

  • A thought leader with demonstrable ability to evaluate architecture and infrastructure and make recommendations for improvement at enterprise architect/CIO/CTO level, making use of the MuleSoft platform and supporting applications
  • Ability to evaluate and connect technical needs with line of business needs and to demonstrate both technical and industry expertise for a customer’s industry vertical
  • Experience leading and architecting enterprise-level programs in solution areas consistent with MuleSoft’s product vision (i.e., SOA, application integration, API design and management)
  • Experience with MuleSoft (or similar) and related agile software development technologies and languages
  • Technically astute and able to drive the development of product software features and extensions through collaboration with both internal and partner engineering teams
  • Deep interest in making customers successful and in expanding their use of MuleSoft products and services
  • Comfortable managing own workload, priorities and ambiguity
  • Confident presentation and customer facing skills

About Our Benefits:

  • Pre-IPO equity
  • Private medical
  • Pension
  • 25 days holiday
  • Mac or PC
  • Fully stocked kitchen, regular catered lunches
  • Annual company-wide weeklong MeetUp trip for collaboration, learning, and inspiration

name: Senior Application Developer-MEAN Stack
contents:
Overview

 

Join our growing team and use your extensive web development expertise to develop and maintain applications. This is a challenging opportunity to work with a team of analysts and other developers to solve key business systems-related problems and improve existing processes.


Responsibilities:

  • Use your coding and problem-solving skills to develop and support web applications in a fast-paced, high-energy agile team environment
  • Develop and review architecture plans
  • Coordinate with others across the organization to build fully integrated systems
  • Participate in code and security reviews
  • Create unit test plans and develop integration tests
  • Troubleshoot and resolve varying levels of technical issues
  • Add value by being current with new trends and frameworks within the JavaScript community

Requirements

  • A minimum of seven years of JavaScript and HTML experience
  • Ability to apply functional programming principles
  • Experience with AngularJS and Node.js
  • Experience with relational and NoSQL databases, preferably MongoDB
  • Experience with REST APIs
  • Experience with full SDLC and Agile development methodologies, application development life cycle, testing, performance tuning, and debugging
  • Strong teamwork and excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Bachelor’s in information systems, computer science, or related field, or equivalent relevant work experience, depending on position level

Recommended Qualifications:

  • Experience with cloud services
  • Experience with AWS services such as Simple Queue, Simple Notification, and Redis
  • Knowledge of third-party JavaScript tools such as Kendo UI
  • Proficient in asynchronous and scalable service oriented architectures
  • User interface design and usability expertise
  • Experience with SaaS application back office integration (SAP, Salesforce.com)
  • Experience developing with JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS3
  • Experience with version control systems such as Git

 

The Company

Our passion for improving quality of life through geography is at the heart of everything we do. Esri’s geographic information system (GIS) technology inspires and enables governments, universities, and businesses worldwide to save money, lives, and our environment through a deeper understanding of the changing world around them.


Carefully managed growth and zero debt give Esri stability that is uncommon in today's volatile business world. Privately held, we offer exceptional benefits, competitive salaries, 401(k) and profit-sharing programs, opportunities for personal and professional growth, and much more.


Esri is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law..

name: Part Time Front-End Web Development Instructor
contents:
In this 10-week part-time course, students learn to code, speak the language and implement their own designs by learning HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. We are looking for instructor to lead this transformative experience through General Assembly’s part-time Front-End Web Development course.

Skills and Qualifications

  • You are eager to shape the skills, minds, and trajectories of eager General Assembly Students.
  • You are the person that your colleagues naturally gravitate to when they are trying to figure something out.
  • You have at least 3 years of experience in Front-end Web Development.
  • You have understanding in the following topics: HTML/CSS (strong/expert understanding) and JavaScript/jQuery (intermediate understanding).
  • Nice to have: UX design experience.

Essential Responsibilities and Duties

  • Teach two, 3-hour part-time classes per week, for 10 weeks.
  • Work alongside GA staff and teaching team to best meet the needs and learning styles of your students.
  • Guide students through development of a stellar final project that translates business logic into pixel perfect website.
  • Facilitate a dynamic and collaborative classroom community.
  • Assist students outside of class as necessary.

Who Are We?

General Assembly is a venture-backed, NYC-based startup focusing on education for individuals and enterprises in the areas of technology, design, and entrepreneurship. We currently have physical classrooms in 8 cities across 4 continents, with tens of thousands of students coming through our doors.

name: Senior Software Engineer (Java)
contents:
Trustwave helps businesses fight cybercrime, protect data and reduce security risk. With cloud and managed security services, integrated technologies and a team of security experts, ethical hackers and researchers, Trustwave enables businesses to transform the way they manage their information security and compliance programs. Trustwave delivers automated, efficient and cost-effective threat, vulnerability and compliance management.

Trustwave is a privately held company, headquartered in Chicago, with customers in 96 countries. For more information about Trustwave, visit https://www.trustwave.com.

Trustwave is looking for a talented, highly motivated Senior Software Engineer with 5+ years of experience to join its Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) product team in Cambridge, Ontario, Canada.

The Senior Software Engineer will be working with multiple dynamic and creative software engineering teams.  This person will take a leadership role in the design, implementation and support of Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) software in a Java/Linux environment.

The ideal candidate has 5+ years of experience in developing enterprise level 24x7 high performance multi-tier systems, with different footprints, for very-high-data rate environments.

Requirements:
A minimum undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent, and demonstrable experiences as listed below: 

  • 5+ years of experience with commercial software product development spanning multiple releases
  • 3+ years of Java development for distributed enterprise, cloud or embedded applications - experience in C# and C++ will also be considered
  • 2+ years of experience with RDBMS or NoSQL platforms
  • 2+ years of experience with Open Source tools and systems such as JBoss, Tomcat, Spring, Kafka, openSSL, C3P0, ActiveMQ, Apache Felix
  • 3+ years of experience developing in a Linux environment
  • 1+ years of experience with 'Big Data' environments

 
Additional preferred skills:

  • Experience with very high rate data environments - billions of rows of data per day
  • Expertise in the use of networking technologies, socket programming and cryptographic infrastructures
  • Low level experience with MySQL, including query optimization
  • Experience with MariaDB
  • Experience with scripting technologies including Linux shell scripting, Ruby
  • Familiarity with Stream Processing Platforms like Storm, Spark
  • Experience with building Domain Specific Languages
  • Experience with NoSQL and NewSQL technologies like Hadoop, Cassandra, MongoDB, TokuDB, infoBright, VoltDB
  • Familiarity with Search Tree algorithms
  • Experience in tuning software for virtual platforms
  • Familiarity with rules engines
  • CISSP and/or CISA designations
  • Understanding of IT security, IT security technologies and security products/devices (e.g. firewalls, IPS, IDS, OS log events, Syslogs, etc.)
  • Deep familiarity with Linux performance tuning
  • Leadership experience with small teams


Education:
We prefer University-educated applicants, but at minimum, high school diploma or equivalent is required for employment.

Trustwave is an Equal Opportunity Employer of Minorities, Females, Protected Veterans, and Individuals with Disabilities.

To All Agencies:

Please, no phone calls or emails to any employee of Trustwave outside of the Talent Acquisition team. Trustwave’s policy is to only accept resumes from agencies via the Trustwave Agency Portal. Agencies must have a valid fee agreement in place and they must have been assigned the specific requisition to which they submit resumes, by the Talent Acquisition team. Any resume submitted outside of this process will be deemed the sole property of Trustwave and in the event a candidate is submitted outside of this policy is hired, no fee or payment of any kind will be paid.

name: Sales Engineer
contents:
Sales Engineer (Director Level)

kWantera founded in 2012, is a purpose-built predictive analytics software company, using AI and machine learning to transform the way retailers, suppliers and large consumers buy and sell energy. They have recently launched their new platform, Faraday, the first AI powered solution for the energy markets.

The Role

Reporting to the Chief Commercial Officer, the Sales Engineer will be a significant contributor to the top-line revenue growth and will be responsible for the complete sales cycle from initial cultivation, relationship development, contractual & commercial proposal phases, and long-term account management and will therefore participate in business process improvement definition and development of key partnerships. This includes providing guidance, leadership and overall direction to the executive team as well as leading key contract negotiations kWantera will have significant expectations of revenue growth and will rely on the Sales Engineer to generate an increase in sales pipeline activities as well as to close on opportunities.

The Sales Engineer will provide significant VOC (Voice of customer) interaction to help form new product developments and improvements. They will also be an integral part of defining strategy, providing insight into the market dynamics and for improving customer expectations.

Required Skills

• Minimum of 5-7 years of sales or sales engineering experience, or a client-facing role which includes negotiation or customer relationship management.
• Detailed technical knowledge in either software technology or in the energy markets. Additional skills should include strong commercial awareness with direct experience in contract negotiations.
• The ability to mobilize stakeholders and influence others within a small team, as well as exceptional collaboration skills are critical for success.
• The ability to communicate and work effectively with all levels of the organization and with customers/colleagues from all backgrounds and cultures is a must.
• The ability to network, develop relationships, potential cold-call with limited experience or relationships with a potential client is mandatory.
• Degree in Engineering or equivalent program.

We offer

At kWantera, we promote a highly dedicated, collaborative and creative work environment, where our employees take ownership of their role, taking much pride from their work. We offer a demanding and challenging position in a dynamic environment. You will have the opportunity to work with highly motivated and passionate people while developing your expertise in a small-sized, multi-cultural and highly diverse community. The position is based in a metropolitan city in the US.

Other

Headquartered in Pittsburgh, PA; candidate may be located in any major metropolitan US city.
Due to the intensive customer focus of our sales team significant travel, frequently with minimal notice, is required.

name: Middle/Senior JavaScript Engineer
contents:
Omnigon (www.omnigon.com) is looking for a Middle/Senior JavaScript Engineer who can work at a fast pace and deliver custom solutions for our clients, leaders in the sports, media and entertainment industries.  

You would join a solid JavaScript team and work to design, develop, build, deploy and maintain complex systems and projects. 

At Omnigon, we are fortunate to work with the world’s leading sports, media and entertainment companies, many of whom operate 24/7. We work tirelessly to support our clients.  

Tech Stack

1. JS Framework - http://canjs.com/ (will move toward http://donejs.com/)
2. Modular dependency Loading system - http://stealjs.com/ (on top of https://github.com/systemjs/systemjs, part of DoneJS)
3. jQuery
4. Handlebars for server side rendering
5. Unit Tests – Jasmine + Karma
6. Gulp
7. Less
8. ES6 (soon)

Browsers:

- Latest Chrome, FF, Safari
- 3 last versions of IE
- iOS Safary
- Android Chrome

 

Hire Requirements:


Senior JS Developer

ES6
OOP in JS
Modules and Loaders
Deep understanding of the MVC/MVVM concepts
Solid knowledge and experience with several MVC/MVVM JS frameworks
NPM
Gulp and creating own tasks for
Remote Debugging
Unit Testing
CSS Preprocessors
Git and branching workflows
English (Upper Intermediate)

Middle JS Developer

OOP in JS
Understanding of the MVC/MVVM concepts
Solid knowledge and experience with at least one MVC/MVVM JS framework
NPM
Gulp
Remote Debugging
CSS Preprocessors
Git
English (Pre-Intermediate)

Benefits:

  • Competitive salary with regular pay and yearly bonus
  • 24 days paid vacation and sick leave
  • Medical Insurance
  • Gym Membership
  • Good working environment, office conveniently located in the center of Kiev
  • English courses
  • Opportunity to improve English skills by regular communication with native speakers

About Omnigon:

Omnigon is a team of digital strategists, artists and technologists working exclusively in digital content delivery in the sports, media and entertainment industries. Since its founding in 2008, Omnigon has established itself as a market leader, focused on helping clients achieve returns on the strategic, creative and technical investments they’ve made. Omnigon, headquartered in New York and with offices in Los Angeles, London, Toronto, Kiev and St. Petersburg, works with celebrated, global brands including PGA TOUR, AS Roma, NASCAR, World Rugby, Arsenal FC, Little League International, the United States Golf Association (USGA), FOX Sports, Miami Heat and countless others.

name: DevOps Engineer
contents:
Omnigon builds sites, apps, and systems for some of the biggest teams and brands in the world.  We are looking for a solid DevOps Engineer to join our team.  

Our DevOps Systems Engineers help plan, build, and maintain highly available and highly reliable systems.  Our development team is full of SWANs; Smart, Willing, Able and Nice people.  Together, we grow and continiously learn to deliver better product.  Our DevOps engineers are key to automating and building operational tools to ease infrastructure provisioning, monitoring and scaling.  They improve our deployments, release processing, and system performance.   

Would you like the opportunity to work on projects seen by millions of people daily?
Are you interested in developing products for clients in the Sports and Entertainment world?
If so, Omnigon might be the place for you.

Required skills:

  • 4+ years of working experience in Linux/Unix administration (CentOS / Redhat / Ubuntu);
  • Good knowledge of Bourne shell scripting;
  • Solid knowledge of TCP/IP, HTTP, DNS, netstat, tcpdump, grep, sed, etc.
  • MySQL configuration/optimization/maintenance/backups/failover;
  • SNMP, Nagios
  • Apache, Nginx configuration (SSL, redirects, auth, etc)
  • Tomcat and Java app server configurations
  • Cloud automation: Chef
  • Amazon AWS: Eleastic Load Balancer, CloudFormation, EC2, RDS
  • Experience with MongoDB

Nice to know:

  • Python
  • Ruby
  • Varnish scripting

Benefits:

  • Competitive salary with regular pay and yearly bonus
  • 24 days paid vacation and sick leave
  • Medical Insurance
  • Gym Membership
  • Good working environment, office conveniently located in the center of Kiev
  • English courses
  • Opportunity to improve English skills by regular communication with native speakers

About Omnigon:

Omnigon is a team of digital strategists, artists and technologists working exclusively in digital content delivery in the sports, media and entertainment industries. Since its founding in 2008, Omnigon has established itself as a market leader, focused on helping clients achieve returns on the strategic, creative and technical investments they’ve made. Omnigon, headquartered in New York and with offices in Los Angeles, London, Toronto, Kiev and St. Petersburg, works with celebrated, global brands including PGA TOUR, AS Roma, NASCAR, World Rugby, Arsenal FC, Little League International, the United States Golf Association (USGA), FOX Sports, Miami Heat and countless others.

name: Software Engineer- Backend
contents:
The Role:
You will be working with a team of other backend engineers to build the backend infrastructure that drives the Peloton platform.  We’re looking for someone passionate about data and performance. You’ll be working on a fast moving team that’s rapidly changing the face of fitness industry.

On a typical day, you will:

  • Help lead backend development and engineering
  • Design and architect features from the ground up for a rapidly growing business
  • Improve and contribute to current development and engineering practices


Candidate Qualifications:

  • Worked as one of the engineers on large scale internet applications who have played an instrumental role in its development and design
  • Experienced Python developer 
  • Having a diverse knowledge of other programming languages is a plus
  • Solid understanding of software design principles
  • Experience with at least one database engine (MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Cassandra, etc.)


About Peloton:
Founded in 2012, Peloton has transformed the at-home fitness experience by creating a bike that merges high-design with modern technology to provide access to live streaming and on demand indoor cycling classes led by elite instructors. With a state of the art studio, the best instructors and content distribution, Peloton delivers an intense high-energy workout that motivates, while positively changing the mind and body.

name: Survey Equipment Outside Sales
contents:
Survey Equipment Outside Sales Representative (Vancouver)

As one of Cansel’s Sales Reps, you will need hutzpah and drive. Reporting to the Regional Sales Manager, you will oversee your sales territory and be primarily responsible for hunting and driving new sales opportunities, along with growing and maintaining existing customer relationships and business while representing Cansel. Along with the rest of the Cansel sales team, you will work directly with large accounts and actively pursue new business.

In this role, you will:

  • Actively hunt for new business opportunities by identifying needs of new and existing customers, following trends in the Industry market, and discovering leads. This will include on-site demonstrations and cold-calling throughout your territory.
  • Maintain existing customer/volume base through regular customer contact, monitoring, and development
  • Provide excellent customer service to key accounts
  • Meet all sales target performance indicators
  • Perform sales presentations and demonstrations
  • Participate in trade-shows, training events or other related events as requested and required
  • Provide reports to Regional Sales Manager on activity and new pipelines

About you:

  • An energetic, self-starter with an entrepreneurial spirit and passion for selling in a competitive market
  • Imperative you have experience in the Construction, Survey and/or Engineering (AEC) industries
  • Some experience in an outside sales role, preferably in the AEC Industries
  • Proven track record in successfully achieving/exceeding sales targets
  • Experience recommending, presenting, and selling a number of products based on customer needs
  • Initiative, self-motivation, flexibility, drive, and superb communication and computer skills are essential
  • Willingness to spend 40-60% of time on the road (locally and occasionally overnight) servicing and visiting customers
  • Driving license in good standing
  • Creative problem-solving skills and business savvy

Bonus Points:

  • Post-secondary degree/diploma in a relevant field (Construction/Survey/Civil Engineering) or equivalent, or a combination of experience and training
  • Familiarity with Salesforce or other CRMs

Why choose Cansel?

Cansel offers a competitive compensation package, uncapped commission structures, flexible health and dental benefits, and more. With us, you will have unbeatable career potential in an industry-leading organization consistently expanding its horizons through ongoing acquisitions of businesses and new products.

We are unique, innovative, and always deliver to our customers, so it only stands to reason that we want unique, innovative, and service-oriented individuals on our team – that’s where you come in. If you identify with the opportunities and challenges of this role and want to discuss what you bring to the table, apply today and pursue excellence with Cansel, your way.

Cansel optimizes workflow from field to finish by providing integrated software, hardware, training, and professional services, and is a national distributor of survey, mapping and GIS instruments, General Line Construction accessories, Autodesk® Premier Solutions, Wide Format printing equipment, paper and supplies, as well as printing services. Our company has been an industry-leader for over fifty years and operates from 18 locations nationwide.

We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and of the broad diversity of our employees. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment regardless of race, ethnicity, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability, or age.

name: Senior Software Engineer - (API, Search, Recommendation)
contents:
Scribd

/skribbed/ (n).

  1. a tech company changing the way the world reads
  2. a membership that gives users access to the world’s largest online library of books, audiobooks, comic books, and sheet music

We value trying new things, craftsmanship, being an open book, and the people that make our team great.

Join us and build something meaningful.

 

About the Search & Recommendation Team

We're looking for strong engineers with either experience or interest in payments, search, or recommendation.

Because this team works on features including recommendations, search, payments and the mobile app API, we use a wide variety of technologies including Ruby on Rails, Go, ElasticSearch, Spark/Hadoop, MySQL, Sphinx, and Redis. Our team boasts several recent accomplishments such as a distributed, scaling, caching image server in Go that processes millions of images a day and a fuzzy matching text filter that can instantly detect two similar, but not identical, passages of text out of a database of all the books in the world.

Some projects we are currently tackling:

  • Building the world's best recommendation engine for books (machine learning in Spark, runtime in Ruby and Go). We are working on the book equivalent of Pandora's "Music Genome Project": an ambitious project to organize all the books in the world and use it to take book discovery to the next level.
  • Scaling backend search infrastructure (using technologies like Elasticsearch, Solr, HDFS, Spark, Hive, and Go) to achieve a low latency and high availability search service for our website and our apps.
  • Improving search quality by implementing and tuning ranking algorithms, indexing schemes, and better search suggestions.
  • Building well designed and fast API endpoints for our mobile apps (in Ruby and Go).
  • Migrating our payments system to a new payment gateway and implement new payment methods and features to increase revenue.

About you

  • 5-7+ years experience writing and shipping clean code that works
  • Solid background in algorithms with a focus on applied problem solving
  • Bachelor's or higher in mathematics, computer science, physics, or equivalent experience
  • strong SQL skills and the ability to analyze large and complex datasets

The Details

  • We are located in downtown San Francisco, just a few minutes’ walk from BART
  • 100% employer covered Medical/Dental/Vision for regular, full-time employees
  • We have a small budget for our employees to attend conferences, classes, and other events
  • We have a lot of trust with very little bureaucracy
  • Three meals a day, catered from local restaurants
  • Coffee and tea runs every afternoon
  • Apple laptops and Thunderbolt displays
  • Company events that include monthly happy hours and off-sites (past events include Safari West, Stinson Beach, ski trips, etc)
  • In the meantime, check out our office and meet some of the team on The Muse!

name: iOS Software Engineer
contents:
WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR:

We are looking for an iOS Software Engineer who is comfortable and proficient working in a fast-paced Agile environment.

You will be a key contributor to our iOS group, focusing on mobile applications for Fortune 500 clients. Working closely with teammates from other groups (Product, QA and UX/UI), we require someone with strong communication and people skills.

WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING:

Domain analysis and design, application development and testing, code and design reviews

Analyze and troubleshoot issues and defects in environments; analyze performance and design inefficiencies.

Following best practices for development such as continuous integration,unit and integration testing and code coverage analysis.

Joining a SCRUM team and following agile patterns and methodology

Stay abreast of the latest technologies and tools being used to improve software development and delivery.

WHAT SKILLS YOU’LL NEED:

1+ Years experience of mobile app development

Success shipping at least one iOS app to the App Store

A degree in Computer Science or related field is preferred

Basic Data Structures and Algorithm knowledge and understanding

C & Objective C

Swift

Xcode (interface Builder, Instruments)

Test Driven Development

UIKit / Core Animation

Understanding of KVO concepts and Web Service concepts.

Knowledge of iOS

Strong Core Data knowledge, Animation knowledge, URL Loading System

Fluent in Design Patterns

WHAT WE OFFER YOU:

Competitive salary (commensurate with experience) with weekly paychecks, great bonus potential, benefits (health insurance, paid holidays, sick days & PTO) and 401K plan with company matching.

Exceptional career growth opportunities

Work with a smart, diverse and driven team that's been developing mobile software since 2003.

Casual office atmosphere, in-house yoga, snacks & frequent company outings and events.

This is an on-site position. Please no telecommuting.

PRINCIPALS ONLY. NO RECRUITERS PLEASE

name: Solutions Architect: Minneapolis
contents:
Job Purpose

As a member of The Nerdery’s Solutions Design team, you will work closely with Sales Directors, Account Executives, and other members of the Solutions Design team (“Sales”) to win new strategic opportunities. You will draw on contextual knowledge from experience in order to ideate, design, estimate, and propose solutions to new and existing clients. Deep knowledge (e.g. market value, competitive landscape, regulations, industry terminology) of one or more industries (e.g. Healthcare, Retail, Manufacturing) will empower you to be exceptionally empathetic and consultative to clients and to tailor custom solutions to them.

Solutions Architects are able to rapidly build domain knowledge, evaluate symptoms and root causes, facilitate discovery/definition workshops, and explain findings to clients with a breadth of technical and business awareness. Solutions Architects apply standard principles (e.g. Design Thinking) to identify and define business problems, elicit requirements, correlate related constraints and requirements, and ideate and propose sound solutions to them. Solutions Architects drive toward The Nerdery’s sales goal by providing dedicated consultative, technical sales support to Sales teams throughout the entire the sales lifecycle, with a focus on generating new business and helping to secure new accounts for The Nerdery.

Duties

  • Provide strategic support to the Sales organization during all aspects of the sales process, including sales calls, sales meetings, partner briefings, estimate creation and delivery, and scope of work writing assistance

  • Responsible for the effectiveness of technical, engagement, and strategy decisions during the sales planning process with account executives, clients, and potential clients of The Nerdery

  • Responsible for the creation and delivery of high quality sales collateral to clients

  • Responsible for effective delegation to and collaboration with subject matter expert resources during the sales process, particularly while generating high quality estimates and proposals

  • Responsible for collaborating with Sales to identify accounts that can be targeted for consultative opportunity development

  • Conceptualize, propose, and conduct intensive workshop sessions with our clients in order to clearly define business problems and opportunities; to ideate, estimate, and propose solutions to them; and to secure new business as a result

  • Define solutions with full consideration of business requirements, user needs/expectations, and technology constraints

  • Participate in negotiation of scope versus estimate as needed

  • Rapidly develop a contextual understanding of client domain through business discovery, data intelligence, or observational research

  • Model, prototype, and evaluate desirable outcomes, and architect strategies to attain them, including development roadmaps, organization design, service blueprints (functional scopes of work), and experience frameworks

  • Uncover additional opportunities for consultation or business technology

  • Potential for up to 35% travel and/ or on-site work at client locations as dictated by engagement requirements

  • Protect The Nerdery and its clients by keeping information confidential

  • Exemplify and adhere to The Nerdery’s core values

Skills/Qualifications

  • Experience and a driving passion to grow domain knowledge within one or more specified industries (Healthcare, Retail, Manufacturing, Professional Services)

  • Demonstrates ability to employ strategic thinking and strategic planning

  • Strong analytic capability with proven ability to determine root causes from symptoms, and define root requirements for prescribed solutions

  • Advanced understanding of a variety of software development processes, design patterns, and methodologies

  • Ability to architect and document solutions at a fully functional level during the sales process

  • Advanced understanding of sales and supporting operations

  • Demonstrates strong business acumen

  • Able to reconcile and articulate ideas for many audiences; excellent written, verbal, visual, technical and nontechnical communication skills

  • Experience working in multiple business domains

  • Capable of understanding the impact of business requirements on the technologies being used to implement

Education/Experience

  • 4-year B.S. degree in a technical field such as computer science, computer engineering, visual or industrial design, or business analytics

  • 5+ years experience in a Solutions Architect (or similar) role

  • Extensive knowledge of enterprise platforms such as Sitecore, Sharepoint, Salesforce, Workday, etc.

  • Deep experience in the Healthcare or Manufacturing industries and relevant business problems

  • Experience working with consultants and/or complex sales teams in a client facing role is required

  • Bonus: Post-graduate degree

  • Bonus: PMO experience

  • Bonus: Active contributor within industry/ Solutions Architect community (blog author, published content, speaker, etc.)
  • Bonus: Industry certifications (e.g. Certified Business Analyst, PMP, Six Sigma, HIPAA, etc.)

name: Operations Engineer - Dublin
contents:
This is a senior technical operations position. It is based in Dublin and reports directly to the Director of Operations.

Use your extensive knowledge of Linux and your desire to make everything 'just work' to keep a complex, high-volume web-app running optimally.

From tracking statistics and managing alerts to deploying new hosts and debugging intricate production issues, this role requires managing a large and varied infrastructure as it grows. The position also includes building out the appropriate tools to make your own job easier, planning for future platform growth and anything else that comes up.

Requirements

  • A deep and abiding love of Linux. Or a respectful hatred for it. Either way, you'll need to be able to sed/awk/grep like a pro.
  • Strong background in deployment automation/configuration management, especially Chef
  • Experience with virtualized environments (AWS experience a plus)
  • Ability to analyze and optimize performance in high-traffic internet applications
  • Fluency with the LAMP stack
  • A constant desire to improve, learn more and take things higher
  • A familiarity with a wide variety of software development methodologies, tools, languages and approaches
  • At least two years operations engineering experience, a large portion of which in a team environment
  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field, or equivalent training, fellowship, or work experience

Bonus Points

  • Experience deploying to EC2
  • Experience with Solr
  • Solid competency with SQL (ideally in a federated database environment, MySQL a plus) and browser technologies
  • Prior experience with or knowledge of large scale, high volume systems
  • Experience in small start-up environments

name: Senior DevOps Engineer
contents:
We are looking for a strong DevOps engineer to help build out and run our production environment as well as our build, test and deployment infrastructure. We have a high bar for security, compliance and reliability to meet in the health care space and need someone who can build our systems accordingly. On the AWS production system, this will involve working with Amazon to understand security best practices in the health care space, help select tools to manage and enforce this security, and create the scripts to run them. High quality code can only be built with the help of strong test framework within a CI environment and supporting tools. This position will help build out such an environment as well as any other supporting tools needed to deliver a system and meets our quality requirements.

If many or most of the following items apply to you, we'd love to talk!

  • Coding Chops
  • A BS or Master in Computer Science or related field
  • Have worked with Chef, Puppet, Ansible or similar provisioning tools
  • Be able to set up Vagrant or Docker
  • Have an eye for web (systems) security
  • Have extensive experience with AWS
  • Have setup (or eager to learn) and managed either a continuous integration or a continuous development process

Collective Health is a technology company working to create the healthcare experience we all deserve. Founded in 2013, our team of engineers, designers, product managers, and actuaries are redefining the $1 trillion-dollar market of employer-sponsored health benefits with data-driven and people-focused products. Our complete health benefits solution helps great companies like Activision Blizzard, Zendesk, and Palantir take care of their people by harnessing the power of design and technology. Based in San Francisco, CA, we’re backed by some of the best investors in Silicon Valley including Google Ventures, Founders Fund, NEA, and Redpoint Ventures. For more information, visit us at https://www.collectivehealth.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

name: Your Dream Job
contents:
Us:

At Andela, we find the brightest young people in Africa, train them to be world-class developers and connect them with employers around the world seeking top technical talent. Passion, excellence, entrepreneurial spirit and determination to improve the status quo are only a few of the many resources the remarkable Andela team brings with them.

You:

Want to join us at Andela to change the world, but not sure how you would fit on the team based on our current openings?

We are constantly on the hunt for new people, but a lot of times it is difficult to assess how people will be great contributors based on their backgrounds.  Here is your chance to tell us how you can be!

Before submitting, just remember: we are most excited about people who can take initiative, prove that they can bring value to our team, and show that they have some startup hustle by calling their unique skills to our attention.  In other words, don't let this prompt be a limit.  Rather, let it be a guide as to what you need to show to prove that you would be an awesome addition to Andela.  So feel free to contact us by other means about how you can change the world with us!

name: Controls Engineer
contents:
TAMKO Building Products, Inc. is seeking a Controls Engineer at our Engineering and Construction facility in Webb City, Missouri.  The position will report to the Senior Controls Engineer in the Engineering and Construction (E&C) division of TAMKO.  As part of E&C, the Controls Engineer will provide support to all manufacturing locations by optimizing the efficiency and reliability of new and existing web handling production processes with special emphasis on migration of Siemens 505 series PLC’s to Step 7 PLC’s.  Optimization skills for Siemens S120 drive systems and Wonderware object oriented HMI development in System Platform is a plus.  In addition to the previously mentioned skills, basic troubleshooting and technical support for the above identified platforms are fundamental requirements.

Educational Background and Prior Experience
B.S. in Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent.  2+ years of industry experience with web-handling applications and controls/drives programming.

Travel: 25-50%

Job Skills/Competencies Required:

  • People
  • Team player
  • Good oral and written communication
  • Excellent time management and organizational skills
  • Highly motivated
  • Creative thinker (ability to think “outside the box”)
  • Customer service oriented
  • Process
  • Advanced knowledge of web handling production processes
  • Fundamental knowledge of manufacturing systems
  • Technical curiosity (mechanical aptitude)
  • Analytical thinker with problem solving/troubleshooting skills
  • Planning/prioritization
  • Equipment
  • Advanced knowledge Siemens Simatic and Simotion drives and controls (emphasis on S120s)
  • Working knowledge of other drives/controllers (i.e. Micromaster, Baldor 18h)
  • PLC logic development (Primarily Siemens 505 and Step 7 (S7) Series Systems)
  • Mechanical/electrical systems
  • Schematic proficiency
  • Working knowledge of AutoCAD
  • Working knowledge of SCADA systems.
  • Required Training (TAMKO provided)
  • DDI Training:  Resolving Conflict
  • Siemens refresher courses
  • Web handling courses and seminars
  • Equipment seminars/tradeshows as required
  • 30-Hour OSHA Training

Key Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Stay Safe.  Take responsibility for your safety, the safety of your co-workers, and the safety of your designs and projects.  Perform all work in a safe manner, report all unsafe conditions, work practices and work related injuries so that corrective action can be promptly initiated.
